results.creator_credit: Joanne Bell and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: The luck of a taxi driver improves when an angel unexpectedly drops in. Cast includes Nigel Cox, James Wardlow, Malcolm Darby, Dennis Scullen, Mary Casey. Cinematography by Ray Boseley.

results.title: Dolores from 10 to 10
results.brief_description:
Dolores from 10 to 10 is a multi-channel installation, adapted from Fusco and Ricardo Dominguez’s 12-hour performance at Kiasma in Helsinki, which was streamed live to the internet in 2001. The work refers to the true story of a maquiladora (assembly line) worker, falsely accused of unionizing workers at her plant. Locked in an office for 12 hours without food, water, or telephone access, she was coerced into signing a letter of resignation. Her lawsuit against her employers was eventually denied on the grounds that she had no ‘proof’.

Dolores from 10 to 10 is Fusco’s interpretation of this real-life internment and a re-construction of what might have been seen if there had been surveillance cameras in the office. Framed by the female labour situation in Mexico, Fusco highlights the inequalities of the relationship between women and technology across the world.

results.title: Come to Daddy
results.brief_description: Chris Cunningham’s infamous film clip for electronic artist Aphex Twins is a terrifying trip into the dark side. The clip begins ominously enough with a young girl skipping down a grotty laneway. When an old lady comes across the child, the little girl reveals a creepy mutated face, which bears a disturbing resemblance to Aphex Twin Richard D. James. As the music begins to freak out, with the refrain ‘I want your soul’ being chanted through the distortion, the helpless old lady ultimately finds herself face to face with sheer horror.

results.title: Done Bali
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Kerry Negara, Tony Chapman and Negara Productions
results.brief_description: This program looks at the history of Bali, including the commercialisation of it’s culture, tourism and the impact of Western influences upon such things as education. It examines the role played by tourism as an agent of change, and questions the inevitability of change upon this small island.

results.title: Donald in Mathmagic land
results.creator_credit: Hamilton Luske, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Donald Duck participates in a remarkable adventure and learns that music, architecture, art and science are all based on mathematical principles. Tracing the history and development of these principles, we find the Arabs responsible for our present numbers and algebra; Egypt the source of geometric theories, the pyramids remaining as a monument to their knowledge of the triangle; and to the Greeks Pythagoras we owe our musical scale.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hamilton Luske, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Productions

results.title: Donald's fire survival plan
results.creator_credit: Les Clark, Ken Peterson and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: The need for a fire survival plan in the home. Every day over 1500 homes burn, and 18 lives are lost, one third of them children. Schools, industrial plants and public buildings practise proper procedures, why not homes? Donald Duck works out a plan to protect his family in case of fire.
